conclusion: Points O, A, and B lie on the same straight line passing through the origin.
The gas follows V ∝ T (i.e., V/T is constant) because points O, A, and B lie on the same straight line.
For point B, the coordinates read directly from the graph are V_B = 0.60 m³, T_B = 300 K.
Calculate V_B / T_B = 0.60 m³ / 300 K = 2.0 × 10⁻³ m³ K⁻¹, which is the constant V/T for every state on the line.
State A is shown at V_A = 0.40 m³.
Using the constant ratio, calculate T_A = V_A / (V/T) = 0.40 m³ / (2.0 × 10⁻³ m³ K⁻¹) = 2.0 × 10² K.
Temperature at state A is T_A = 200 K.
